frameDefinitions: An Agent, Actor, Entity, or Medium causes a Phenomenon to be perceived by a Perceiver.
Water in some solid or liquid form (the Precipitation) falls from the sky at a particular Place and Time, lasting for a particular Duration.
A Payer gives up (or potentially gives up) the use of an Asset (generally money) in order to achieve an Intended_event.
A Communicator or Medium briefly references something in a Message, in which only a subpart of the full content is profiled.
A Communicator communicates a judgment of an Evaluee to an Addressee.
A Speaker mentions a Specified_entity filling a Role, thereby providing information which supports a point of the Speaker.
frameExamples: It 'll <t>cost</t> Sandra's parents fifty grand a year for her to attend that school.
The General Secretary <t>mentions</t> some of them in his report.
I <t>commended</t> his handling of the crisis.
He cites the chief original observations <t>adduced</t> by Darwin as evidence for his theory.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agent</fen> intentionally creates a situation in which the <fen>Perceiver</fen> observes or experiences the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is an entity or idea that is perceived by the <fen>Perceiver</fen>.
The <fen>Perceiver</fen> is made to have a perceptual experience by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
An <fen>Actor</fen> is a sentient being who is exhibiting, possibly uninintentionally, some <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
An object that has some association with a <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The <fen>Medium</fen> through which a <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is expressed.
When the event occurs.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> causes the perception of the <fen>Perceiver</fen>.
The water in liquid or solid form that falls from the sky is the Precipitation. This role is incorporated in many LUs in this frame.
The area which experiences precipitation.
When the event occurs.
The role <fen>Goods</fen> is the item(s) whose price is being assessed.  <fen>Goods</fen> is usually an External Argument:
The person whose <fen>Asset</fen> is given up in order to achieve an <fen>Intended_event</fen>.  This role is often expressed as INI.
The price of or payment made for the Goods.
The event that the <fen>Payer</fen> brings about by deploying the <fen>Asset</fen>.
The time when a transaction takes place.
The person who uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey a <fen>Message</fen> to another person.
A proposition or set of propositions that the <fen>Communicator</fen> wants the <fen>Addressee</fen> to believe or take for granted.
The physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Message</fen> is conveyed.
The relevant entity or state-of-affairs that the <fen>Communicator</fen> mentions.
When the the <fen>Message</fen> is mentioned.
The location where the <fen>Communicator</fen> communicates the <fen>Message</fen>.
The <fen>Communicator</fen> uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey his or her evaluation of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> to another person.
<fen>Medium</fen> identifies the physical or abstract setting in which the evaluation is conveyed.
<fen>Topic</fen> identifies the entity to which the proposition or propositions conveyed relate.
A judgment is made about the <fen>Evaluee</fen>  With verbs this role is typically expressed as Object:
<fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part that conveys the judgment made by the <fen>Communicator</fen>.
Typically, there is a constituent expressing the <t>Reason</t> for the <fen>Communicator</fen>'s judgment. It is usually a <ment>for</ment>-PP.
When the communication of the judgment takes place.
Where the communication of the judgment takes place.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the person who specifies the <fen>Role</fen> to be filled by the <fen>Specified_entity</fen>.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the statement.
The entity that the <fen>Speaker</fen> identifies as filling a particular <fen>Role</fen>.
A slot in a particular or generic event or relation whose filler the <fen>Speaker</fen> identifies.
The time when the statement is made.
The role specifies the place where the statement takes place.
listRoleExamples: It will probably be raining <fex>at five o'clock</fex>.
<fex>These paintings</fex> are very pricey.
A holiday in Europe is very expensive <fex>for me</fex>.
The painting was cheap <fex>at $600</fex>.
<fex>Attending summer school</fex> is expensive.
No, they've got a special on; it's really cheap there <fex>on Tuesdays</fex>
<fex>Her father</fex> never mentioned it.
A CBS report did mention <fex>that the First Lady was required to wear a flak jacket for her safety</fex>.
<fex>The report</fex> also mentioned contamination problems during the manufacture.
If someone mentions <fex>things like ration books</fex> , my stomach turns.
<fex>Jon</fex> belittled Madie to her colleagues.
Jon belittled Madie <fex>over the telephone</fex>.
Jon criticized Madie <fex>about her managerial style</fex>.
Jon belittled <fex>Madie</fex> to her colleagues.
She viewed him with a critical <fex>gaze</fex>.
Jon extolled Madie <fex>for her efforts</fex>.
He received critical acclaim <fex>last week</fex>.
He was belittled by his long-time friend <fex>in front of his family</fex>.
But<fex>Arturo Boncato Jr., marketing manager of the Marco Polo Hotel,</fex> cited the high occupancy rates in the hotels as proof of increasing visitors' confidence.
<fex>In a subsequent paper</fex> he adduced further evidence.

Reilly pointed <fex>to the high labor costs</fex> as the
main reason for the decision to close down the New Orleans facility.
TCI named the overly expensive bid price <fex>as the main reason for their strict opposition against a merger</fex>.

Persistent, heavy rainfall and poorly maintained drainage systems were cited
<fex>yesterday</fex> as the prime causes for the rising floodwaters
<fex>In Kuala Lumpur</fex>, he also pointed to the accountability/assessment arena as a place for new businesses to investigate.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Israel Intelligence Heritage & Commemoration Centre (IICC)
"Perils of Dominance: Imbalance of Power and the Road to War in Vietnam"
the Intelligence and Terrorism Information Center (ITIC)
